subject: Log updater stats once per pass, not per policy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-30 21:41:53.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/updater.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_updater.py'], 'message': 'Log updater stats once per pass, not per policy

The object updater emits a log line saying "Object update sweep
completed on <disk> in <time>: <lots-of-stats>" after finishing each
storage policy's async pendings. That's not right; an update sweep is
completed on a device when you've looked at all the async pendings on
the device.

This commit moves the "sweep completed" message so it's once per
device, not per policy.

Change-Id: Ibb5f02a18ac431da230afe30c556a756f60d1680
'}]
commit_message:
Log updater stats once per pass, not per policy

The object updater emits a log line saying "Object update sweep
completed on <disk> in <time>: <lots-of-stats>" after finishing each
storage policy's async pendings. That's not right; an update sweep is
completed on a device when you've looked at all the async pendings on
the device.

This commit moves the "sweep completed" message so it's once per
device, not per policy.

Change-Id: Ibb5f02a18ac431da230afe30c556a756f60d1680

subject: Correct test_v3_oauth1.test_bad_authorizing_roles_name
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-02 02:04:22.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_oauth1.py'], 'message': 'Correct test_v3_oauth1.test_bad_authorizing_roles_name

`test_bad_authorizing_roles_name` was incorrecting using .admin_request
instead of self.put. During the conversion to flask, this results in the
incorrect HTTP 404 (server text/html instead of application
(application/json); the incorrect behavior was due to dispatching to
and un-routed URI. In the legacy keystone wsgi, this was still handled
by the application and erroneously raised a 404 that looked correct.

The use of .put instead of .admin_request simply adds in the /v3 prefix
to the url returned by .authorize_request_token making the routing
now hit the proper controller method.

Change-Id: I1bdfbcaf1c3b6d0d86e2819b65d73af45bc7644d
'}]
commit_message:
Correct test_v3_oauth1.test_bad_authorizing_roles_name

`test_bad_authorizing_roles_name` was incorrecting using .admin_request
instead of self.put. During the conversion to flask, this results in the
incorrect HTTP 404 (server text/html instead of application
(application/json); the incorrect behavior was due to dispatching to
and un-routed URI. In the legacy keystone wsgi, this was still handled
by the application and erroneously raised a 404 that looked correct.

The use of .put instead of .admin_request simply adds in the /v3 prefix
to the url returned by .authorize_request_token making the routing
now hit the proper controller method.

Change-Id: I1bdfbcaf1c3b6d0d86e2819b65d73af45bc7644d

subject: Move database creation into role
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-01 14:55:14.000000000', 'files': ['examples/playbook.yml', 'tasks/horizon_db_setup.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Move database creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement a new variable called 'horizon_db_setup_host'
which is used in the role to allow delegation of the database setup
task to any host, but defaults to the first member of the galera_all
host group. We also document the variable horizon_galera_address which
has been used for a long time, but never documented.

Change-Id: I7946c325d87c74e2bd9b1dcc1f92ea09a5386729
"}]
commit_message:
Move database creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement a new variable called 'horizon_db_setup_host'
which is used in the role to allow delegation of the database setup
task to any host, but defaults to the first member of the galera_all
host group. We also document the variable horizon_galera_address which
has been used for a long time, but never documented.

Change-Id: I7946c325d87c74e2bd9b1dcc1f92ea09a5386729

task to any host, but defaults to the first member of the galera_all
host group. We also document the variable ironic_galera_address which
has been used for a long time, but never documented.

Change-Id: I8502d4aba54870a54900c3218563d66b864a1876
"}]
commit_message:
Move database creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement a new variable called 'ironic_db_setup_host'
which is used in the role to allow delegation of the database setup
task to any host, but defaults to the first member of the galera_all
host group. We also document the variable ironic_galera_address which
has been used for a long time, but never documented.

Change-Id: I8502d4aba54870a54900c3218563d66b864a1876

subject: Do not pip install keystoneclient on the host
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-06-04 07:41:35.000000000', 'files': ['vars/redhat-7.yml', 'vars/suse-42.yml', 'vars/debian.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Do not pip install keystoneclient on the host

The keystoneclient package is being installed on the host by PIP but
that means that a whole bunch of required dependencies are being pulled
in as well.

This brings the host to a rather messed up state when installing
keystone from distro packages, since distribution and
PIP packages are being mixed together. We only need the client to
register the service with keystone so we can simply use the distro
package for that to avoid installing lots of PIP packages on the
host.

Change-Id: Id5d79db00e1a4aa4983aafd92c088ef8f13a7da0
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages
'}]
commit_message:
Do not pip install keystoneclient on the host

The keystoneclient package is being installed on the host by PIP but
that means that a whole bunch of required dependencies are being pulled
in as well.

This brings the host to a rather messed up state when installing
keystone from distro packages, since distribution and
PIP packages are being mixed together. We only need the client to
register the service with keystone so we can simply use the distro
package for that to avoid installing lots of PIP packages on the
host.

Change-Id: Id5d79db00e1a4aa4983aafd92c088ef8f13a7da0
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages

subject: Add support for using distribution packages for OpenStack services
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-06-04 07:41:35.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'vars/source_install.yml', 'vars/distro_install.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/openstack-distribution-packages-b1c9e1f488e53872.yaml', 'vars/debian.yml', 'tasks/swift_install_source.yml', 'defaults/main.yml', 'tasks/swift_install.yml', 'vars/redhat-7.yml', 'vars/suse-42.yml', 'zuul.d/project.yaml', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Add support for using distribution packages for OpenStack services

Distributions provide packages for the OpenStack services so we add
support for using these instead of the pip ones. However, functional
testing is not complete yet since it requires tempest to be in the swift
virtual environment which doesn't exist for distro installs. As such,
for functional testing to cover this method of installation it needs
to be changed quite a bit.

Change-Id: Id75e56440685df407a9991018dc07b5a75429082
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for using distribution packages for OpenStack services

Distributions provide packages for the OpenStack services so we add
support for using these instead of the pip ones. However, functional
testing is not complete yet since it requires tempest to be in the swift
virtual environment which doesn't exist for distro installs. As such,
for functional testing to cover this method of installation it needs
to be changed quite a bit.

Change-Id: Id75e56440685df407a9991018dc07b5a75429082
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages

commit_message:
Rename test files to test_* pattern

We're going to switch to default Django test runner by default.
This patch renames test files to make tests descoverable by
Nose and Django test runners without addidional configuration.

Related blueprint: improve-horizon-testing

Change-Id: I16022a448139958905746cc37520c345b48d6970

commit_message:
provide more detail about the expectations we place on goal champions

At least one of our goal champions was under the mistaken impression
that they were responsible for writing all of the patches for teams
that did not complete the goal themselves. This patch adds more detail
about what responsibility a champion has, and what things are not
their responsibility.

Story: #2001706
Task: #8699
Change-Id: Ie00f793378ed2ec870210ffd480f29a510a427d5
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Mark Vedams-HPMSA Drivers unsupported

The Vedams-HPMSA drivers have not run 3rd Party CI
in more than 60 days.  This patch marks them
unsupported and they will be removed in Stein
if the 3rd Party CI Issues are not resolved.

Change-Id: I78dc1d8b43599599eb3e225990fa0a1784459a33

subject: Add ssh_network input
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-30 18:01:08.000000000', 'files': ['workbooks/deployment.yaml', 'tripleo_common/actions/ansible.py'], 'message': 'Add ssh_network input

In some cases, we may not want to always assume the ctlplane as the network to
use for generating the ansible inventory. This patches adds a new workflow
input, ssh_network that can be used to set the network name to be used.
Defaults to ctlplane.

Change-Id: I1e3f9a5142bff5e4f77e5e40df164089d9144652
'}]
commit_message:
Add ssh_network input

In some cases, we may not want to always assume the ctlplane as the network to
use for generating the ansible inventory. This patches adds a new workflow
input, ssh_network that can be used to set the network name to be used.
Defaults to ctlplane.

Change-Id: I1e3f9a5142bff5e4f77e5e40df164089d9144652

commit_message:
Ensure namespace creation event is detected

Moving to on_present instead of on_added to both:
- Follow the same style we have for handling pods
- Ensure no namespace creation event gets missed, as ADDED event seems
to be missed when using openshift

Partially Implements: blueprint network-namespace

Change-Id: I7bded22266098f31740e508f8210eabc602d8349

commit_message:
vars: Do not pull devel packages on distro installations

The devel packages are only needed to build the pip pacakges so we don't
need them when we install packages straight from the distro repos.

Change-Id: If06f702ee881480b78f9a406fe626d9020837fd3
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages

commit_message:
openstack overcloud failures

Add a new command to tripleoclient:
openstack overcloud failures

The command shows the deployment failures based on a plan name and makes
use of the tripleo.deployment.v1.get_plan_deployment_failures
workflow.

Change-Id: I9ce4ab9e6c690abb5aed887f8fe6add4bbf52167
Depends-On: I16d2dd0b3022cd5964919d07dd0ec603490a3ed7

subject: Create docker-puppet.sh only once to avoid ETXTBSY errors
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2011, 'name': 'Ian Main', 'email': 'imain@redhat.com', 'username': 'imain'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 6681, 'name': 'Brent Eagles', 'email': 'beagles@redhat.com', 'username': 'beagles'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 13039, 'name': 'Martin André', 'email': 'm.andre@redhat.com', 'username': 'mandre'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-06-01 05:17:48.000000000', 'files': ['docker/docker-puppet.py'], 'message': 'Create docker-puppet.sh only once to avoid ETXTBSY errors

We currently create /var/lib/docker-puppet/docker-puppet.sh
inside the mp_puppet_config() function which then gets
invoked in parallel via the following:

  p = multiprocessing.Pool(process_count)
  returncodes = list(p.map(mp_puppet_config, process_map))

This is problematic because we have the following potential race:
1) Process A opens /var/lib/docker-puppet/docker-puppet.sh for writing
2) Process B runs docker run and has the following bind mount:
   /var/lib/docker-puppet/docker-puppet.sh:/var/lib/docker-puppet/docker-puppet.sh:z
3) Process B will fail because an exec of a file being written to
   will return ETXTBSY

The deployment can fail due to the above with the following error:
[root@overcloud-controller-2 ~]# docker ps -a
CONTAINER ID IMAGE COMMAND CREATED STATUS PORTS NAMES
a401108cd827 192.168.24.1:8787/tripleoqueens/centos-binary-glance-api:current-tripleo-rdo "/var/lib/docker-p..." 19 minutes ago Exited (1) 19 minutes ago docker-puppet-glance_api
[root@overcloud-controller-2 ~]# docker logs docker-puppet-glance_api
standard_init_linux.go:178: exec user process caused "text file busy"

Since /var/lib/docker-puppet/docker-puppet.sh never changes
there is really no need to create it multiple times. Let's just
create it once before spawning the multiple docker run commands
so we avoid any ETXTBSY errors.

Ran 20 successful deployments in sequence with this change applied.

Change-Id: I16b19488ce9f1411273459576db76d16b318dacb
Closes-Bug: #1760787
'}]
commit_message:
Create docker-puppet.sh only once to avoid ETXTBSY errors

We currently create /var/lib/docker-puppet/docker-puppet.sh
inside the mp_puppet_config() function which then gets
invoked in parallel via the following:

  p = multiprocessing.Pool(process_count)
  returncodes = list(p.map(mp_puppet_config, process_map))

This is problematic because we have the following potential race:
1) Process A opens /var/lib/docker-puppet/docker-puppet.sh for writing
2) Process B runs docker run and has the following bind mount:
   /var/lib/docker-puppet/docker-puppet.sh:/var/lib/docker-puppet/docker-puppet.sh:z
3) Process B will fail because an exec of a file being written to
   will return ETXTBSY

The deployment can fail due to the above with the following error:
[root@overcloud-controller-2 ~]# docker ps -a
CONTAINER ID IMAGE COMMAND CREATED STATUS PORTS NAMES
a401108cd827 192.168.24.1:8787/tripleoqueens/centos-binary-glance-api:current-tripleo-rdo "/var/lib/docker-p..." 19 minutes ago Exited (1) 19 minutes ago docker-puppet-glance_api
[root@overcloud-controller-2 ~]# docker logs docker-puppet-glance_api
standard_init_linux.go:178: exec user process caused "text file busy"

Since /var/lib/docker-puppet/docker-puppet.sh never changes
there is really no need to create it multiple times. Let's just
create it once before spawning the multiple docker run commands
so we avoid any ETXTBSY errors.

Ran 20 successful deployments in sequence with this change applied.

Change-Id: I16b19488ce9f1411273459576db76d16b318dacb
Closes-Bug: #1760787

subject: Use a nginx conf.d file for the custom logging
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-25 10:41:26.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/keystone_nginx.yml'], 'message': "Use a nginx conf.d file for the custom logging

To cater for the situation where there are no containers, or
nginx is shared in some way, it's better to add custom directives
for nginx.conf into a conf.d file. That way it's never overwritten.

To resolve the situation where repo_server overwrites the config
laid down by os_keystone, we implement the custom log in this way.

The task which verifies that the right config directories exist
is modified to ensure that both the sites and the conf.d directories
exist before this configuration is laid down. For CentOS/OpenSUSE
they are the same directory, but for Ubuntu they are different.

This patch also ensurs that the previous implementation is removed,
otherwise an upgrade fails. This patch should be back portable to
ensure that zero-container deploys for Queens work properly.

Change-Id: I2ab0f591c1cdeae43a002d9c8cf9bbfdd69597f1
(cherry picked from commit bbd70d5f9b56f53fd37bf91d99365a3a4e17bee7)
"}]
commit_message:
Use a nginx conf.d file for the custom logging

To cater for the situation where there are no containers, or
nginx is shared in some way, it's better to add custom directives
for nginx.conf into a conf.d file. That way it's never overwritten.

To resolve the situation where repo_server overwrites the config
laid down by os_keystone, we implement the custom log in this way.

The task which verifies that the right config directories exist
is modified to ensure that both the sites and the conf.d directories
exist before this configuration is laid down. For CentOS/OpenSUSE
they are the same directory, but for Ubuntu they are different.

This patch also ensurs that the previous implementation is removed,
otherwise an upgrade fails. This patch should be back portable to
ensure that zero-container deploys for Queens work properly.

Change-Id: I2ab0f591c1cdeae43a002d9c8cf9bbfdd69597f1
(cherry picked from commit bbd70d5f9b56f53fd37bf91d99365a3a4e17bee7)

vars: Do not pull devel packages on distro installations

need them when we install packages straight from the distro repos.

subject: Only replace python when re-initializing the venv
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-23 08:25:20.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/watcher_install.yml'], 'message': "Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: I9205f5f3183eff8059e7589b6a3a2bbf36f8b60a
Partial-Bug: #1764470
(cherry picked from commit 1f606ff46173bd04990891b2d833b1443d6e04a7)
"}]
commit_message:
Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: I9205f5f3183eff8059e7589b6a3a2bbf36f8b60a
Partial-Bug: #1764470
(cherry picked from commit 1f606ff46173bd04990891b2d833b1443d6e04a7)

commit_message:
No reformat

Do not reformat devices.  A subsequent change will be necessary
to account for conditions where a reformat is still desired,
such as a set of blocking states and user-driven actions.

Partial-bug: #1698154

Depends-On: I90a866aa138d18e4242783c42d4c7c587f696d7d
Change-Id: I3a41ab38e7a1679cf4f5380a7cc56556da3aaf2b

subject: Remove the reformat option, add check of device pristinity
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2018-06-04 10:20:19.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_utils.py', 'ceph/utils.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Remove the reformat option, add check of device pristinity

As a part of the mitigation of LP Bug #1698154 remove the reformat
option and initialization of journal devices entirely. Ceph charms
can rely on actions to have operator administratively execute
zap_disk.

There should not be a code path that could accidentally execute
zap_disk without administrative intervention.

Make py27 test noop

Flip pep8 test to py3

Partial-Bug: #1698154
Change-Id: I90a866aa138d18e4242783c42d4c7c587f696d7d
'}]
commit_message:
Remove the reformat option, add check of device pristinity

As a part of the mitigation of LP Bug #1698154 remove the reformat
option and initialization of journal devices entirely. Ceph charms
can rely on actions to have operator administratively execute
zap_disk.

There should not be a code path that could accidentally execute
zap_disk without administrative intervention.

Make py27 test noop

Flip pep8 test to py3

Partial-Bug: #1698154
Change-Id: I90a866aa138d18e4242783c42d4c7c587f696d7d

commit_message:
Remove duplication from test-requirements.txt

We don't need to keep runtime dependencies in the text-requirements.txt
because of they are installed by tox while using 'usedevelop = True'
config option.

This patch also uncaps version of the networkx because it's handled by
upper-constraints now.

Change-Id: Ib55bd1e8cd1c88b8ea37f3aaa1e0f3c616a622f1

commit_message:
Move tempest plugin install to the end

When installing the tempest plugin we need to ensure that this is the
last thing that gets done in the plugin, otherwise it might collide with
container build.

Change-Id: Ib16dbbee265c8536806926f62c2e906108ffa88c

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-09 08:20:02.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/vrouter-hw-offloads-edab39fb6a0cbe7f.yaml', 'nova/virt/libvirt/vif.py', 'nova/privsep/libvirt.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_vif.py'], 'message': "Add plumbing for Contrail/Tungsten Fabric offloads

* This change expands the VNIC type support for the vrouter VIF type by
  adding 'direct' and 'virtio-forwarder' plugging support.

* After this change, the vrouter VIF type will support the following three
  modes:
  * 'normal': the 'classic' tap-style VNIC plugged into the instance,
  * 'direct': a PCI Virtual Function is passed through to the instance,
  * 'virtio-forwarder': a PCI Virtual Function is proxied to the
    instance via a vhost-user virtio forwarder.

* The libvirt xml generation code was updated to support the modes.

* The Nova legacy VIF plugging code was updated to support the modes.

* The privsep wrapper for the vrouter port control binary was updated.

* The vrouter VIF unit test cases were refreshed and extended.

* The corresponding review on OpenContrail is currently at:
  https://review.opencontrail.org/#/c/42850/

Change-Id: Iea71323562a14379a78672c12027cd8e73547e68
Signed-off-by: Jan Gutter <jan.gutter@netronome.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add plumbing for Contrail/Tungsten Fabric offloads

* This change expands the VNIC type support for the vrouter VIF type by
  adding 'direct' and 'virtio-forwarder' plugging support.

* After this change, the vrouter VIF type will support the following three
  modes:
  * 'normal': the 'classic' tap-style VNIC plugged into the instance,
  * 'direct': a PCI Virtual Function is passed through to the instance,
  * 'virtio-forwarder': a PCI Virtual Function is proxied to the
    instance via a vhost-user virtio forwarder.

* The libvirt xml generation code was updated to support the modes.

* The Nova legacy VIF plugging code was updated to support the modes.

* The privsep wrapper for the vrouter port control binary was updated.

* The vrouter VIF unit test cases were refreshed and extended.

* The corresponding review on OpenContrail is currently at:
  https://review.opencontrail.org/#/c/42850/

Change-Id: Iea71323562a14379a78672c12027cd8e73547e68
Signed-off-by: Jan Gutter <jan.gutter@netronome.com>

We'll be using this role for windmill to help manage openstacksdk
project. We'll be publishing IRC notications and not applying for
official openstack project.

subject: Update constraint for python-novaclient to 10.1.0
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-06-04 03:39:18.000000000', 'files': ['upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Update constraint for python-novaclient to 10.1.0

This constraint update was originally tried [1] awhile back and failed
because novaclient had removed some functionality that openstackclient
needed for providing floating ip and host commands. So we had to leave
the constraint at 9.1.1 pike for novaclient, but this prevented users
from being able to use the volume multi-attach feature out-of-the-box
in queens.

To improve the situation for users, the openstackclient stable branch
team allowed us to backport changes to stable/queens that would make
queens openstackclient work with novaclient 10.1.0 (queens). We have
requested a new release with those changes as a dependency here.

Once openstackclient 3.14.2 for queens is released, we would like to
update the constraint for novaclient queens to 10.1.0 to enable use
of the volume multi-attach feature out-of-the-box for queens.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/538070

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/571537

Change-Id: I6e6b5dd95b0d5f54b3e8e2fce5bf303e91de42b7
'}]
commit_message:
Update constraint for python-novaclient to 10.1.0

This constraint update was originally tried [1] awhile back and failed
because novaclient had removed some functionality that openstackclient
needed for providing floating ip and host commands. So we had to leave
the constraint at 9.1.1 pike for novaclient, but this prevented users
from being able to use the volume multi-attach feature out-of-the-box
in queens.

To improve the situation for users, the openstackclient stable branch
team allowed us to backport changes to stable/queens that would make
queens openstackclient work with novaclient 10.1.0 (queens). We have
requested a new release with those changes as a dependency here.

Once openstackclient 3.14.2 for queens is released, we would like to
update the constraint for novaclient queens to 10.1.0 to enable use
of the volume multi-attach feature out-of-the-box for queens.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/538070

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/571537

Change-Id: I6e6b5dd95b0d5f54b3e8e2fce5bf303e91de42b7

commit_message:
Remove trusty beaker job template

The only project that was using this template was puppet-infracloud,
which doesn't really need it. Clean up the template, the job and the
supporting playbooks to make migrating the beaker jobs to zuulv3 easier.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/571024
Change-Id: I4df3fb0207cf421656a6e6b62712ed6abbcea0ad

commit_message:
Following the new PTI for document build

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface [1]
as described in [2]

[1]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html
[2]
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

So this affect nothing and run in PEP8.

Related-Bug: #1765348

commit_message:
Add freezer-scheduler hosts into site.yml

freezer-scheduer container will run on freezer-scheduler hosts[0],
but it missing in site.yml, when freezer-api and freezer-scheduler
run on different hosts, it will failed.

[0]: https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/inventory/multinode#L376

Change-Id: I1bd36c7c57345ee63cd153df8bd0603badf0d8a2

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

commit_message:
Use real package name

In the mitaka cycle, the Ubuntu neutron plugin packages
were renamed, and transitional packages were created.

Use the real name of the linuxbridge plugin package to
reflect reality.

Change-Id: I12e1ee45b7a9cfee0d42ba66a34d2e5f4267ca2e
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <charles.short@ericsson.com>

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-06-01 13:57:56.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/vif.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_vif.py'], 'message': "Pass virtio multiqueue info to os-vif plugins

 * The VIFGeneric os-vif type is used for the kernel TAP based
   plugging. If the os-vif plugin has not created a TAP device, the
   hypervisor will create one (multiqueue enabled, if set). If the
   os-vif plugin has to create a multiqueue TAP device, it needs a hint
   if multiqueue is desired.
 * This hint is passed by checking the port_profile of the os-vif object
   for the 'virtio_multiqueue' field before plugging. If it exists and
   is 'None', it is updated with the result from the multiqueue check.
 * Update the multiqueue check to take an instance.
 * Update the unit tests to correctly mock the instance object for
   multiple testcases.
 * Added unit tests for the multiqueue check.

   is in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570959

   is problematic.

Depends-On: Ifbc44337c09e0f2ccf421798803ff7e794ed0b70
Change-Id: I1a449c3d77309193b22caadb9e48323d7b1510c6
Signed-off-by: Jan Gutter <jan.gutter@netronome.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Pass virtio multiqueue info to os-vif plugins

 * The VIFGeneric os-vif type is used for the kernel TAP based
   plugging. If the os-vif plugin has not created a TAP device, the
   hypervisor will create one (multiqueue enabled, if set). If the
   os-vif plugin has to create a multiqueue TAP device, it needs a hint
   if multiqueue is desired.
 * This hint is passed by checking the port_profile of the os-vif object
   for the 'virtio_multiqueue' field before plugging. If it exists and
   is 'None', it is updated with the result from the multiqueue check.
 * Update the multiqueue check to take an instance.
 * Update the unit tests to correctly mock the instance object for
   multiple testcases.
 * Added unit tests for the multiqueue check.
 * The first os-vif port profile to support the virtio_multiqueue field
   is in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570959
 * Until the above review is merged, writing testcases for this codepath
   is problematic.

Depends-On: Ifbc44337c09e0f2ccf421798803ff7e794ed0b70
Change-Id: I1a449c3d77309193b22caadb9e48323d7b1510c6
Signed-off-by: Jan Gutter <jan.gutter@netronome.com>

subject: Mention neutron-rootwrap-daemon in root_helper_daemon option help
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-31 21:45:29.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/conf/agent/common.py'], 'message': "Mention neutron-rootwrap-daemon in root_helper_daemon option help

An operators mailing list thread [1] discussing scale issues
where vif plugging times out eventually came to the conclusion
that several operators run rootwrap in the neutron agent in daemon
mode.

This ability is not clear from the configuration option help, however,
so this change adds more details on running in this mode to achieve
scale. Another nice discussion about this can be found here [2].

There is a corresponding nova patch [3] to mention this option
if operators are hitting vif plugging timeouts in nova.

This doesn't change any defaults, it just improves the documentation.

The help text formatting is also updated for easier readability
and maintainability in the source.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-operators/2018-May/015364.html
[2] https://cloudblog.switch.ch/2017/08/28/starting-1000-instances-on-switchengines/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/571577/

Change-Id: I8b8a0cfea409c3469ad0ee223c87e0380b3afbad
Closes-Bug: #1774217
"}]
commit_message:
Mention neutron-rootwrap-daemon in root_helper_daemon option help

An operators mailing list thread [1] discussing scale issues
where vif plugging times out eventually came to the conclusion
that several operators run rootwrap in the neutron agent in daemon
mode.

This ability is not clear from the configuration option help, however,
so this change adds more details on running in this mode to achieve
scale. Another nice discussion about this can be found here [2].

There is a corresponding nova patch [3] to mention this option
if operators are hitting vif plugging timeouts in nova.

This doesn't change any defaults, it just improves the documentation.

The help text formatting is also updated for easier readability
and maintainability in the source.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-operators/2018-May/015364.html
[2] https://cloudblog.switch.ch/2017/08/28/starting-1000-instances-on-switchengines/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/571577/

Change-Id: I8b8a0cfea409c3469ad0ee223c87e0380b3afbad
Closes-Bug: #1774217

revisions:

Ubuntu 18.04 has been released. We need upgrade to it this cycle.

Changes made in this patch

- Bump ubuntu repo from xenial to bionic. Some repos do not have bionic
  packages, so still using xenial repos.
- Drop mariadb, percona and nfs-ganesha repo, because these packages are
  already provided by Ubuntu official repo.
- Since qdrouterd does not have bionic repo and xenial packages does not
  work on Ubuntu bionic, just add it into ignore image list.
- Use python-rtslib-fb and targetcli-fb rather than python-rtslib
  and targetcli
- use xen-utils package name rather than with package version one.
- Seems unsigned repo won't work on Ubuntu bionic, stop using infra
  mirrored unsigned repo in gate building job.

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/568728
Implement blueprint: ubuntu-bionic
Change-Id: I4e3b0ca669cfbf6316bf591f2d8428fa1a0d6182
"}]
commit_message:
Bump Ubuntu base image to 18.04

Ubuntu 18.04 has been released. We need upgrade to it this cycle.

Changes made in this patch

- Bump ubuntu repo from xenial to bionic. Some repos do not have bionic
  packages, so still using xenial repos.
- Drop mariadb, percona and nfs-ganesha repo, because these packages are
  already provided by Ubuntu official repo.
- Since qdrouterd does not have bionic repo and xenial packages does not
  work on Ubuntu bionic, just add it into ignore image list.
- Use python-rtslib-fb and targetcli-fb rather than python-rtslib
  and targetcli
- use xen-utils package name rather than with package version one.
- Seems unsigned repo won't work on Ubuntu bionic, stop using infra
  mirrored unsigned repo in gate building job.

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/568728
Implement blueprint: ubuntu-bionic
Change-Id: I4e3b0ca669cfbf6316bf591f2d8428fa1a0d6182

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-04 06:29:03.000000000', 'files': ['kuryr_kubernetes/controller/handlers/lbaas.py'], 'message': "Really ignore unsupported service types

Due to how Kuryr implements service networking, NodePort services are
not supported and nobody brought up a good case for their support.
Without this fix, we'd not generate a proper spec but we'd try to
process them ending up in failure.

Change-Id: I1e02a7a7fdfd2a49b0759f959adedf038bf1ca6e
Closes-Bug: #1774634
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

"}]
commit_message:
Really ignore unsupported service types

Due to how Kuryr implements service networking, NodePort services are
not supported and nobody brought up a good case for their support.
Without this fix, we'd not generate a proper spec but we'd try to
process them ending up in failure.

Change-Id: I1e02a7a7fdfd2a49b0759f959adedf038bf1ca6e
Closes-Bug: #1774634
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>
(cherry picked from commit 71864e8cdd255f015eb82946e6ee3861fbbb5e08)

subject: Release note for supporting Octavia as LoadBalancer type service backend

This also changes stack_get_all_by_owner_id() to not select the

commit_message:
Don't allow nested or stacks in FAILED state to be migrated

Stack and its nested stacks should be in *_COMPLETE state for
it to be migrated. Also, we should not allow migration of a
nested stack.

This also changes stack_get_all_by_owner_id() to not select the
backup stacks. This seems to be used only in convergence code
path and migrate_convergence_1().

Change-Id: Icd54465d0c593557a12d853ddee4ee8ce6483499
Closes-Bug: #1767962
Story: #1767962
Task: #17363
(cherry picked from commit abfec544d7938ad8b576e1d0fa78f8a5dca1df00)

subject: Move database creation into role
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-01 14:29:26.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/heat_db_setup.yml', 'examples/playbook.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Move database creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement a new variable called 'heat_db_setup_host'
which is used in the role to allow delegation of the database setup
task to any host, but defaults to the first member of the galera_all
host group. We also document the variable heat_galera_address which
has been used for a long time, but never documented.

Change-Id: I5f3e73af031aad455dbd8555aa054eac804a55bb
"}]
commit_message:
Move database creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement a new variable called 'heat_db_setup_host'
which is used in the role to allow delegation of the database setup
task to any host, but defaults to the first member of the galera_all
host group. We also document the variable heat_galera_address which
has been used for a long time, but never documented.

Change-Id: I5f3e73af031aad455dbd8555aa054eac804a55bb

commit_message:
Fix local path for templates outside of the plan

In some cases, the local path of templates can be
wrong. For example, if a local path have double
slash, this will result to a failure when the
deployment workflow will launch http request with
double slash.

Change-Id: I91a38cbc6b67bdc5e6303f3ae1930f77103d7987
(cherry picked from commit 18c3ec423309b1fdf2164bbb290c3076d96b3801)

commit_message:
dev mode: Add support for barbican

Provide support fot kolla dev mode in barbican. When
'kolla_dev_mode' or 'barbican_dev_mode' variables are
enabled, source code of barbican project is cloned
and bindmounted.

Partially implements: blueprint mount-sources

Change-Id: I8d48c43cf599548b4536285759ed0078f359538e

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

Update PrettyTable dependency so the tests pass.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I59c771ca583fb0ebc9f39314ee68264410f8a173
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Pike to Queens controller upgrade guard rerun with no images

As discussed at [0] if current overcloud resources are removed
manually/some error, and even container images deleted, the
upgrade tasks should be able to guard.

We already have a similar guard for the fetch&retag at [1]

[0] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1584809
[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/8824e7abcde38b14236de0e4f172ac99852f62b4/docker/services/pacemaker/haproxy.yaml#L305-L324

subject: change ansible command in ansible_sudoers
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-05-30 08:14:36.000000000', 'files': ['docker/kolla-toolbox/ansible_sudoers'], 'message': 'change ansible command in ansible_sudoers

since ansible was moved to virtualenv in kolla_toolbox, the default
executable path was changed to /opt/ansible/bin/ansible. Hence the
ansible command in ansible_sudoers need to be changed correspondingly
in order to ensure kolla-ansible "sudo -E" in container kolla-toolbox
can be executed without hanging.

Closes-Bug: #1773911

Change-Id: Ib9e4899e710e77e7fa5fbaf5c210fe445cdbc6ac
Signed-off-by: Nan Li <herbert.nan@linaro.org>
'}]
commit_message:
change ansible command in ansible_sudoers

since ansible was moved to virtualenv in kolla_toolbox, the default
executable path was changed to /opt/ansible/bin/ansible. Hence the
ansible command in ansible_sudoers need to be changed correspondingly
in order to ensure kolla-ansible "sudo -E" in container kolla-toolbox
can be executed without hanging.

Closes-Bug: #1773911

Change-Id: Ib9e4899e710e77e7fa5fbaf5c210fe445cdbc6ac
Signed-off-by: Nan Li <herbert.nan@linaro.org>

subject: Fix broken gate due to breaking dependency changes
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-06-01 22:34:20.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/tests/plugin/test_kmip.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'barbican/api/controllers/secrets.py', 'barbican/tests/api/test_resources_policy.py', 'barbican/api/controllers/__init__.py', 'functionaltests/api/v1/functional/test_secrets.py', 'barbican/common/accept.py', 'barbican/plugin/kmip_secret_store.py'], 'message': 'Fix broken gate due to breaking dependency changes

PyKMIP changes:

The CredentialType is no longer imported into the credentials
module.  Fixed the reference.  Skipping the accept header tests
till the webob fix is available.

WebOb 1.8.1 changes:

This patch updates the Accept header logic that was broken
by the update in the WebOb dependency.

In the interest of time I had to comment out four functional tests
that will require further work in the content negotiation logic so
we can get the gate working again.

Also shame on the WebOb folks for not bumping the major version
on this breaking change.

Change-Id: Ie4d0df0cca2c79686830931e96b11bbc97a41c5b
Story: 2002122
'}]
commit_message:
Fix broken gate due to breaking dependency changes

PyKMIP changes:

The CredentialType is no longer imported into the credentials
module.  Fixed the reference.  Skipping the accept header tests
till the webob fix is available.

WebOb 1.8.1 changes:

This patch updates the Accept header logic that was broken
by the update in the WebOb dependency.

In the interest of time I had to comment out four functional tests
that will require further work in the content negotiation logic so
we can get the gate working again.

Also shame on the WebOb folks for not bumping the major version
on this breaking change.

Change-Id: Ie4d0df0cca2c79686830931e96b11bbc97a41c5b
Story: 2002122

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-06-02 22:16:18.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Pin cmd2 to the last python2 version of the library

The cmd2-0.9.0 is python3-only and the tempest venv is built
unconstrained, so it's trying to bring in the latest version
which is incompatible with python2. We pin the library to
ensure that the venv build completes correctly.

Depends-On: I35e3688ae632d5f7747f32dafc41d23883c033c5
Change-Id: Id5b9274ce39dec3d5ee295d7ef941bf42ca7cbd2
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Pin cmd2 to the last python2 version of the library

The cmd2-0.9.0 is python3-only and the tempest venv is built
unconstrained, so it's trying to bring in the latest version
which is incompatible with python2. We pin the library to
ensure that the venv build completes correctly.

Depends-On: I35e3688ae632d5f7747f32dafc41d23883c033c5
Change-Id: Id5b9274ce39dec3d5ee295d7ef941bf42ca7cbd2
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add test to shelve the paused server: bug# 1745529

This commit adds test to shelve the paused instance.
As per Nova doc[1], user should be able to shelve the instance
even it is in paused state but this is not happening as per
mentioned bugs and there was no coverage of this scenario in tempest.

..1 https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#shelve-server-shelve-action
Related-Bug: #1745529

Depends-On: I8ca25d9847d50001fbe8513a6c1dba8b697c24e4
Change-Id: Id5782583511e5601c1bc7fe99db7d6d4c479db11

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1736, 'name': 'Ivan Kolodyazhny', 'email': 'e0ne@e0ne.info', 'username': 'e0ne'}, {'_account_id': 6825, 'name': 'Gary W. Smith', 'email': 'garysmith123@gmail.com', 'username': 'gary-w-smith'}, {'_account_id': 8478, 'name': 'Vladislav Kuzmin', 'email': 'vkuzmin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vkuzmin'}, {'_account_id': 8648, 'name': 'Radomir Dopieralski', 'email': 'openstack@dopieralski.pl', 'username': 'thesheep'}, {'_account_id': 11880, 'name': 'Gloria Gu', 'email': 'gloriafanggu@gmail.com', 'username': 'gugl'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-05-23 22:19:33.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/volumes/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/tables.py'], 'message': "Update attach_volume and detach_volume policy rules

The prior commit for this was functional but not quite
correct. The policy rules currently in Horizon for
attach and detach of volumes don't exist in Nova and
are missing from the local copy of nova_policy.json and
from Nova generated policy files. The fix to use the
create instance copy of the rule only worked for attach
and not detach ( https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570071/ )

This commit updates detach as well, and should be correct
going forward based on the Nova policy rules at:
https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/policies/volumes_attachments.py

Change-Id: I07fccd6f12149cd88a049c46aa113dfd2b60bbaa
Closes-bug: 1772759
"}]
commit_message:
Update attach_volume and detach_volume policy rules

The prior commit for this was functional but not quite
correct. The policy rules currently in Horizon for
attach and detach of volumes don't exist in Nova and
are missing from the local copy of nova_policy.json and
from Nova generated policy files. The fix to use the
create instance copy of the rule only worked for attach
and not detach ( https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570071/ )

This commit updates detach as well, and should be correct
going forward based on the Nova policy rules at:
https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/policies/volumes_attachments.py

Change-Id: I07fccd6f12149cd88a049c46aa113dfd2b60bbaa
Closes-bug: 1772759

commit_message:
Add ConfFixture.transport_url

As the first step towards removing rpc_backend, we need all of the test
fixtures to stop setting/using it via ConfFixture.transport_driver. Add
ConfFixture.transport_url, and move the tests over to setting it rather
than transport_driver.

Partial-Bug: #1712399
Change-Id: I6e2ae2b511fdc52790d5755a9aecaf2f427ab706

revisions:

It was unable to upload image when horizon was running on python3,
there was a problem with closed file in new thread. This commit is
fixing this issue with added if clause whether horizon running on
python2 or python3 and correctly call close_called on file when
running on python3.

Change-Id: Ice178f6269ac527ba62b26d86976b5336987c922
Closes-Bug: #1773935

commit_message:
Fix issue with uploading image to glance on Python3

It was unable to upload image when horizon was running on python3,
there was a problem with closed file in new thread. This commit is
fixing this issue with added if clause whether horizon running on
python2 or python3 and correctly call close_called on file when
running on python3.

Change-Id: Ice178f6269ac527ba62b26d86976b5336987c922
Closes-Bug: #1773935

subject: Remove erroneous newline in sample generation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-01 21:29:26.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_policy/tests/test_generator.py', 'oslo_policy/generator.py', 'releasenotes/notes/fix-rendering-for-deprecated-rules-d465292e4155f483.yaml'], 'message': 'Remove erroneous newline in sample generation

The sample generation code for policies has a couple different cases
that make sure deprecated rules have descriptions and reasoning
formatted in the comment section. One of the cases that handles
policies deprecated for removal was injecting an extra newline in the
comment text that threw off the formatting of the sample, leaving
the subsequent policy uncommented, and visually unpleasing.

This commit removes the extra newline in the formatting logic for
deprecated policies and adds a test case for the behavior.

Change-Id: I76338d2fbaccf3b43e0da04732fd9df3c05dfbda
Closes-Bug: 1771442
'}]
commit_message:
Remove erroneous newline in sample generation

The sample generation code for policies has a couple different cases
that make sure deprecated rules have descriptions and reasoning
formatted in the comment section. One of the cases that handles
policies deprecated for removal was injecting an extra newline in the
comment text that threw off the formatting of the sample, leaving
the subsequent policy uncommented, and visually unpleasing.

This commit removes the extra newline in the formatting logic for
deprecated policies and adds a test case for the behavior.

Change-Id: I76338d2fbaccf3b43e0da04732fd9df3c05dfbda
Closes-Bug: 1771442

subject: Replace six.iteritems() with .items()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-06 11:04:09.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/models/fuel_web_client.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ifd63d03d98fe51c5c1daa581f521608c3687897c
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ifd63d03d98fe51c5c1daa581f521608c3687897c

subject: Do not sync time after restarting of node
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-30 13:04:54.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/tests/test_support_hugepages.py', 'fuelweb_test/models/fuel_web_client.py', 'fuelweb_test/tests/test_ceph.py', 'fuelweb_test/tests/test_cgroups.py'], 'message': 'Do not sync time after restarting of node

We have weird bug that can spawn 2 ntpd processes at the same time
by HA mechanism. Actually we have to sync time strictly only after
reverting a snapshot.

Change-Id: Ic73eb942eaacb436629841f9b12df844f3ac736d
Related-bug:1656020
'}]
commit_message:
Do not sync time after restarting of node

We have weird bug that can spawn 2 ntpd processes at the same time
by HA mechanism. Actually we have to sync time strictly only after
reverting a snapshot.

Change-Id: Ic73eb942eaacb436629841f9b12df844f3ac736d
Related-bug:1656020

subject: add waiting of a deploy finishment to check_service_was_restated
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-03-29 10:27:05.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/tests/test_services_reconfiguration.py'], 'message': 'add waiting of a deploy finishment to check_service_was_restated

There is the function to check that service was restarted. And there is
test case two_clusters_reconfiguration, which uploads openstack-config
with
  notify: Service[nova-scheduler]
and checks that puppet restarts the nova-scheduler.

Actually deployment process requires a time. So we have to wait when it
finished before checking nova-scheduler.

Closes-bug: #1673750
Change-Id: Icef1e15489727a13a753b9921df0cc5527f9ab2d
'}]
commit_message:
add waiting of a deploy finishment to check_service_was_restated

There is the function to check that service was restarted. And there is
test case two_clusters_reconfiguration, which uploads openstack-config
with
  notify: Service[nova-scheduler]
and checks that puppet restarts the nova-scheduler.

Actually deployment process requires a time. So we have to wait when it
finished before checking nova-scheduler.

Closes-bug: #1673750
Change-Id: Icef1e15489727a13a753b9921df0cc5527f9ab2d

Closes-Bug: 1670711

commit_message:
Change disk size check

Sometimes order of disks can be changed. So we need
to select disk using type ("qcow2" by default) but
not by index.

Change-Id: I481eb79eff22b990c61d2397d6c96bd93df6687f
Closes-Bug: 1670711
(cherry picked from commit 3d22d0c2662c6586f16a32e37a6f20e4a6889692)

commit_message:
Really ignore unsupported service types

Due to how Kuryr implements service networking, NodePort services are
not supported and nobody brought up a good case for their support.
Without this fix, we'd not generate a proper spec but we'd try to
process them ending up in failure.

Change-Id: I1e02a7a7fdfd2a49b0759f959adedf038bf1ca6e
Closes-Bug: #1774634
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

commit_message:
Fix share-service VM restart problem

The /etc/mtab file may have mount information such as 'nfsd'
that if copied to /etc/fstab will cause the share server to
hang when rebooted.

Update /etc/fstab with exactly the newly mounted or unmounted
shares rather than simply overwriting /etc/fstab with /etc/mtab.

Change-Id: I67602bae1f928769d768008deca7bd0f2fef1ac2
Close-Bug: #1639662

commit_message:

subject: Bump django upper bound
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-06-01 09:21:57.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Bump django upper bound

This commit bumps the upper bound of Django to <2.1.
Django 2.x supports only python3, so this change only affects
Django version used in python3. Django versions used in python2
still continues to be Django 1.11 series.

Django minor version change usually contains backward-incompatible
changes and/or drops deprecated features, so the upper bound is not
dropped so that consumers can know which Django versions are supported.

upper-constraints.txt is not bumped now as django 2.0 support
in horizon plugins are on-going effort.

Change-Id: I9ee7ac8d5f807cc09b28417695ff80c181d82786
'}]
commit_message:
Bump django upper bound

This commit bumps the upper bound of Django to <2.1.
Django 2.x supports only python3, so this change only affects
Django version used in python3. Django versions used in python2
still continues to be Django 1.11 series.

Django minor version change usually contains backward-incompatible
changes and/or drops deprecated features, so the upper bound is not
dropped so that consumers can know which Django versions are supported.

upper-constraints.txt is not bumped now as django 2.0 support
in horizon plugins are on-going effort.

Change-Id: I9ee7ac8d5f807cc09b28417695ff80c181d82786

commit_message:
libvirt: Skip fetching the virtual size of block devices

In this latest episode of `Which CI job has lyarwood broken today?!` we
find that I464bc2b88123a012cd12213beac4b572c3c20a56 introduced a
regression in the nova-lvm experimental job as n-cpu attempted to run
qemu-img info against block devices as an unprivileged user.

For the time being we should skip any attempt to use this command
against block devices until the disk_api layer can make privileged
calls using privsep.

Closes-bug: #1771700
Change-Id: I9653f81ec716f80eb638810f65e2d3cdfeedaa22
(cherry picked from commit fda48219a378d09a9a363078ba161d7f54e32c0a)
(cherry picked from commit 8ea98c56b647526aae7a786531e934eeee7a90a2)

subject: libvirt: handle DiskNotFound during update_available_resource
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12898, 'name': 'Tony Breeds', 'email': 'tony@bakeyournoodle.com', 'username': 'tonyb'}, {'_account_id': 14595, 'name': 'z Systems KVM', 'email': 'zkvm-ci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-zkvm-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16128, 'name': 'IBM PowerVM CI', 'email': 'powervmci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powervmci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26515, 'name': 'Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'nova_hyperv_ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'nova_hyperv_ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-31 09:50:39.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/test_images.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py', 'nova/virt/images.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: handle DiskNotFound during update_available_resource

The update_available_resource periodic task in the compute manager
eventually calls through to the resource tracker and virt driver
get_available_resource method, which gets the guests running on
the hypervisor, and builds up a set of information about the host.
This includes disk information for the active domains.

However, the periodic task can race with instances being deleted
concurrently and the hypervisor can report the domain but the driver
has already deleted the backing files as part of deleting the
instance, and this leads to failures when running "qemu-img info"
on the disk path which is now gone.

When that happens, the entire periodic update fails.

This change simply tries to detect the specific failure from
'qemu-img info' and translate it into a DiskNotFound exception which
the driver can handle. In this case, if the associated instance is
undergoing a task state transition such as moving to another host or
being deleted, we log a message and continue. If the instance is in
steady state (task_state is not set), then we consider it a failure
and re-raise it up.

Note that we could add the deleted=False filter to the instance query
in _get_disk_over_committed_size_total but that doesn't help us in
this case because the hypervisor says the domain is still active
and the instance is not actually considered deleted in the DB yet.

Change-Id: Icec2769bf42455853cbe686fb30fda73df791b25
Closes-Bug: #1662867
(cherry picked from commit 5f16e714f58336344752305f94451e7c7c55742c)
(cherry picked from commit 5a4c6913a37f912489543abd5e12a54feeeb89e2)
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: handle DiskNotFound during update_available_resource

The update_available_resource periodic task in the compute manager
eventually calls through to the resource tracker and virt driver
get_available_resource method, which gets the guests running on
the hypervisor, and builds up a set of information about the host.
This includes disk information for the active domains.

However, the periodic task can race with instances being deleted
concurrently and the hypervisor can report the domain but the driver
has already deleted the backing files as part of deleting the
instance, and this leads to failures when running "qemu-img info"
on the disk path which is now gone.

When that happens, the entire periodic update fails.

This change simply tries to detect the specific failure from
'qemu-img info' and translate it into a DiskNotFound exception which
the driver can handle. In this case, if the associated instance is
undergoing a task state transition such as moving to another host or
being deleted, we log a message and continue. If the instance is in
steady state (task_state is not set), then we consider it a failure
and re-raise it up.

Note that we could add the deleted=False filter to the instance query
in _get_disk_over_committed_size_total but that doesn't help us in
this case because the hypervisor says the domain is still active
and the instance is not actually considered deleted in the DB yet.

Change-Id: Icec2769bf42455853cbe686fb30fda73df791b25
Closes-Bug: #1662867
(cherry picked from commit 5f16e714f58336344752305f94451e7c7c55742c)
(cherry picked from commit 5a4c6913a37f912489543abd5e12a54feeeb89e2)

commit_message:
Prepare gate-check-commit.sh for newton EOL

If we want to still test Ocata upgrades, we need to implement
the workarounds in Newton.

This is to be kept until we consider it's too hard to maintain.
In that case, we can remove the N->O upgrade jobs.

Change-Id: I662dc3fc8cbce59a99c051dd849b791773ae8046

subject: Change lower-constraints for msgpack to 0.5.2
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-06-03 05:23:46.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'lower-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Change lower-constraints for msgpack to 0.5.2

Between 0.5.1 and 0.5.2 the msgpack library changed "raw_as_bytes"
to "raw" and subsequently added a very spammy deprecation message.

To support oslo.serialization eliminating the deprecation warning
moving from "encoding='utf-8'" to "raw=False" this moves the lower
constraint to 0.5.2.

Change-Id: I5afc5f013e9076e9248f46502abbd802ceff0700
'}]
commit_message:
Change lower-constraints for msgpack to 0.5.2

Between 0.5.1 and 0.5.2 the msgpack library changed "raw_as_bytes"
to "raw" and subsequently added a very spammy deprecation message.

To support oslo.serialization eliminating the deprecation warning
moving from "encoding='utf-8'" to "raw=False" this moves the lower
constraint to 0.5.2.

Change-Id: I5afc5f013e9076e9248f46502abbd802ceff0700

subject: Release python-openstackclient 3.14.2 (stable/queens)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-31 17:41:38.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/queens/python-openstackclient.yaml'], 'message': 'Release python-openstackclient 3.14.2 (stable/queens)

This contains a change needed to enable novaclient (that supports the
volume multi-attach feature in queens) to work together with
openstackclient for the queens release.

Once openstackclient is released, we can propose an update of the
novaclient constraints from 9.1.1 => 10.1.0 to enable users to be able
to use the volume multi-attach feature in nova out-of-the-box when they
install the queens release of openstack.

Change-Id: Ic84cf5f4c7ea358a201c0e23cd4135dafbe680d8
'}]
commit_message:
Release python-openstackclient 3.14.2 (stable/queens)

This contains a change needed to enable novaclient (that supports the
volume multi-attach feature in queens) to work together with
openstackclient for the queens release.

Once openstackclient is released, we can propose an update of the
novaclient constraints from 9.1.1 => 10.1.0 to enable users to be able
to use the volume multi-attach feature in nova out-of-the-box when they
install the queens release of openstack.

Change-Id: Ic84cf5f4c7ea358a201c0e23cd4135dafbe680d8

subject: Update to use oslo.messaging services for RPC and Notify
revisions:
[{'number': 18, 'created': '2018-05-30 18:18:53.000000000', 'files': ['tests/inventory', 'tasks/nova_db_setup.yml', 'templates/nova.conf.j2', 'releasenotes/notes/oslo-messaging-separate-backends-1fbdb77e93e29542.yaml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Update to use oslo.messaging services for RPC and Notify

This introduces oslo.messaging variables that define the RPC and
Notify transports for the OpenStack services. These parameters
replace the rabbitmq values and are used to generate the messaging
transport_url for the service. The association of the messaging
backend server to the oslo.messaging services will then be
transparent to the nova service.

This patch:
* Add oslo.messaging variables for RPC and Notify to defaults
* Update transport_url generation
* Add oslo.messaging to inventory
* Add release note

Depends-On: If4326a6848d2d32af284fdbb94798eb0b03734d5
Depends-On: I2b09145b60116c029fc85477399c24f94974b61d
Change-Id: Ia95c5c0dfb3cf42bc31dc311dd853db969acc193
'}]
commit_message:
Update to use oslo.messaging services for RPC and Notify

This introduces oslo.messaging variables that define the RPC and
Notify transports for the OpenStack services. These parameters
replace the rabbitmq values and are used to generate the messaging
transport_url for the service. The association of the messaging
backend server to the oslo.messaging services will then be
transparent to the nova service.

This patch:
* Add oslo.messaging variables for RPC and Notify to defaults
* Update transport_url generation
* Add oslo.messaging to inventory
* Add release note

Depends-On: If4326a6848d2d32af284fdbb94798eb0b03734d5
Depends-On: I2b09145b60116c029fc85477399c24f94974b61d
Change-Id: Ia95c5c0dfb3cf42bc31dc311dd853db969acc193

subject: Only replace python when re-initializing the venv
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-19 15:23:30.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/searchlight_install.yml'], 'message': "Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: I39e64f29e794075ef303d3e1a2c0c1a6a18937b6
Partial-Bug: #1764470
(cherry picked from commit a9561bbce96a0dc545f18aaa88be0988be2ac3ad)
"}]
commit_message:
Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: I39e64f29e794075ef303d3e1a2c0c1a6a18937b6
Partial-Bug: #1764470
(cherry picked from commit a9561bbce96a0dc545f18aaa88be0988be2ac3ad)

commit_message:
Update to use oslo.messaging services for RPC and Notify

This introduces oslo.messaging variables that define the RPC and
Notify transports for the OpenStack services. These parameters
replace the rabbitmq values and are used to generate the messaging
transport_url for the service. The association of the messaging
backend server to the oslo.messaging services will then be
transparent to the glance service.

This patch:
* Add oslo.messaging variables for RPC and Notify to defaults
* Update transport_url generation
* Add oslo.messaging to inventory
* Add release note

Depends-On: If4326a6848d2d32af284fdbb94798eb0b03734d5
Change-Id: Ib647d87df040c77ee3906b1bf58764ca5f3d765d

commit_message:
Do not pip install keystoneclient on the host

The keystoneclient package is being installed on the host by PIP but
that means that a whole bunch of required dependencies are being pulled
in as well.

This brings the host to a rather messed up state when installing
keystone from distro packages, since distribution and
PIP packages are being mixed together. We only need the client to
register the service with keystone so we can simply use the distro
package for that to avoid installing lots of PIP packages on the
host.

Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages
Change-Id: I90c9e6732e71e153aa37f9bf69bdda679439f8b3

commit_message:
Replace port 35357 with 5000 for adminuri

Based on the change in Keystone Install Guide [1],
this patch replace port 35357 with 5000 for adminuri.

For more details, please check similar changes which have been done
on other projects: Nova [2], Neutron [3], Cinder [4], Glance [5].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541857
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562812
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566491
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/565464
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558932

Change-Id: I9cb906fa7ffd58af2edc3c6d80d02c1c147f9f9f

commit_message:
Do not pip install keystoneclient on the host

The keystoneclient package is being installed on the host by PIP but
that means that a whole bunch of required dependencies are being pulled
in as well.

This brings the host to a rather messed up state when installing
keystone from distro packages, since distribution and
PIP packages are being mixed together. We only need the client to
register the service with keystone so we can simply use the distro
package for that to avoid installing lots of PIP packages on the
host.

Change-Id: I1247ae07035451087e70f3e1782dd9c25fe1c554
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages

commit_message:
Update to use oslo.messaging service for RPC and Notify

This introduces oslo.messaging variables that define the RPC and
Notify transports for the OpenStack services. These parameters
replace the rabbitmq values and are used to generate the messaging
transport_url for the service. The association of the messaging
backend server to the oslo.messaging services will then be
transparent to the heat service.

This patch:
* Add oslo.messaging variables for RPC and Notify to defaults
* Update transport_url generation
* Add oslo.messaging to inventory
* Add release note

Depends-On: If4326a6848d2d32af284fdbb94798eb0b03734d5
Depends-On: I2b09145b60116c029fc85477399c24f94974b61d
Change-Id: I4ee0a94028e7390b319d4e1ceb4ab7f7c28ad9ba

commit_message:
Do not pip install keystoneclient on the host

The keystoneclient package is being installed on the host by PIP but
that means that a whole bunch of required dependencies are being pulled
in as well.

This brings the host to a rather messed up state when installing
keystone from distro packages, since distribution and
PIP packages are being mixed together. We only need the client to
register the service with keystone so we can simply use the distro
package for that to avoid installing lots of PIP packages on the
host.

Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages
Change-Id: I3759995cfb8192145d1b871158c95f594751a759

commit_message:
vars: Do not pull devel packages on distro installations

The devel packages are only needed to build the pip pacakges so we don't
need them when we install packages straight from the distro repos.

Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages
Change-Id: Id1d30da7dbca35b5a44215a78110971bda6a4263

subject: Be clear about python3: Remove its support
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-05-09 10:39:22.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/almanach_install.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Be clear about python3: Remove its support

We have never really tested python3 at large scale, and more and
more bugs are filed in stable branches due to dual stack.

We should stick to python2 in the stable branches, which is
what was tested in our gates.

Change-Id: Id4d6dcb6892a7f3b67ee383a29fbbf2771452e9d
'}]
commit_message:
Be clear about python3: Remove its support

We have never really tested python3 at large scale, and more and
more bugs are filed in stable branches due to dual stack.

We should stick to python2 in the stable branches, which is
what was tested in our gates.

Change-Id: Id4d6dcb6892a7f3b67ee383a29fbbf2771452e9d

commit_message:
Options to enable SSL for backend connections

Currently backend connections are always unencrypted. This adds optional
parameters to configure backend connections with SSL. This is useful for
extra services wich require SSL or to have backend connections to
OpenStack services encrypted in the future.

Change-Id: I6a032962ae987bb1cbc4982fb6ddbd06f8e53936
(cherry picked from commit 2d0f483c843d7bd0db8eb7dc5f2f169714c73169)

commit_message:
Update to use oslo.messaging service for RPC and Notify

This introduces oslo.messaging variables that define the RPC and
Notify transports for the OpenStack services. These parameters
replace the rabbitmq values and are used to generate the messaging
transport_url for the service. The association of the messaging
backend server to the oslo.messaging services will then be
transparent to the neutron service.

This patch:
* Add oslo.messaging variables for RPC and Notify to defaults
* Update transport_url generation
* Add oslo.messaging to tests inventories
* Add release note

commit_message:
Remove pycrypto from requirements.txt

Openstack stopped using pycrypto for secrets generation a while back
but the requirement remained in requirements.txt.
This patch removes it.

Change-Id: I1c57ae9f903eefaec4e893bac96692b606996c3e
Closes-Bug: #1749574

commit_message:
Update to use oslo.messaging service for RPC and Notify

This introduces oslo.messaging variables that define the RPC and
Notify transports for the OpenStack services. These parameters
replace the rabbitmq values and are used to generate the messaging
transport_url for the service. The association of the messaging
backend server to the oslo.messaging services will then be
transparent to the sahara service.

This patch:
* Add oslo.messaging variables for RPC and Notify to defaults
* Update transport_url generation
* Add oslo.messaging to inventory
* Add release note

Depends-On: If4326a6848d2d32af284fdbb94798eb0b03734d5
Depends-On: I2b09145b60116c029fc85477399c24f94974b61d
Change-Id: Ib4153412b91e7d11cc9acdbe5af8a1a4280b44e8

commit_message:
Update to use oslo.messaging service for RPC and Notify

This introduces oslo.messaging variables that define the RPC and
Notify transports for the OpenStack services. These parameters
replace the rabbitmq values and are used to generate the messaging
transport_url for the service. The association of the messaging
backend server to the oslo.messaging services will then be
transparent to the ironic service.

* Add oslo.messaging variables for RPC and Notify to defaults
* Update transport_url generation (added notifications)

Right now, when a versionless auth endpoint is used, castellan
ends up trying to use a v2 endpoint.  This fix would default to
v3 if the auth_url is versionless.  Similar changes have been made
in other clients like swift for instance (

'}]
commit_message:
Default to v3 auth endpoint when version not set

Right now, when a versionless auth endpoint is used, castellan
ends up trying to use a v2 endpoint.  This fix would default to
v3 if the auth_url is versionless.  Similar changes have been made
in other clients like swift for instance (
see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/473740)

Change-Id: I971e8d02c4b3580eba9b6e6658952ef7d45dcb5c

subject: Raise warning if top-level value is not a dict
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-05-29 13:43:25.000000000', 'files': ['os_api_ref/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Raise warning if top-level value is not a dict

Given the following 'parameters.yaml' file:

  resources_query_granular:
    type: string
    in: query
    required: false
    description: |
      Some description here...
  min_version: 1.22

Clearly 'min_version' is indented at the wrong level. However, the error
message is pretty much useless:

  Exception occurred:
    File "./os_api_ref/__init__.py", line 261, in _check_yaml_sorting
      if value['in'] not in sections:
    TypeError: string indices must be integers, not str

It's obvious we should be saying _what_ is causing this issue. Start
doing this by way of an exception.

Change-Id: If68f82de1e3bf37b1ab89f12adf78e0d8d123674
'}]
commit_message:
Raise warning if top-level value is not a dict

Given the following 'parameters.yaml' file:

  resources_query_granular:
    type: string
    in: query
    required: false
    description: |
      Some description here...
  min_version: 1.22

Clearly 'min_version' is indented at the wrong level. However, the error
message is pretty much useless:

  Exception occurred:
    File "./os_api_ref/__init__.py", line 261, in _check_yaml_sorting
      if value['in'] not in sections:
    TypeError: string indices must be integers, not str

It's obvious we should be saying _what_ is causing this issue. Start
doing this by way of an exception.

Change-Id: If68f82de1e3bf37b1ab89f12adf78e0d8d123674

commit_message:
Fix erroneous ACL for puppet-pacemaker

puppet-pacemaker was recently added and retained tagging and
branching rights in its new ACL. We don't do that anymore,
as things are driven from the openstack/releases repository.

Change-Id: I3f77af2f8019395b33dfd6b6a9a2f9a7a0d986ac

subject: Remove direct tagging/branching for PowerVMStackers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-01 14:13:04.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/acls/openstack/networking-powervm.config', 'gerrit/acls/openstack/nova-powervm.config'], 'message': 'Remove direct tagging/branching for PowerVMStackers

The release process for official OpenStack components now uses
release requests using changes proposed to the openstack/releases
git repository. This allows peer review of release requests,
including version numbers, and run a series of checks to make
sure the release is likely to be successful once the tag is
pushed. The same process supports the creation of additional repo
branches as well. This all ensures that releases are reported
correctly on the releases.openstack.org website.

As a result of this process, nobody needs to push tags directly
or create branches directly. As an official OpenStack project
team, PowerVMStackers has switched to using that process already
for recent releases. However the ACLs were not fixed to remove
direct tagging/branching yet.

Change-Id: I7b9db2c47f226032527405b8d5b0fe29c825e205
'}]
commit_message:
Remove direct tagging/branching for PowerVMStackers

The release process for official OpenStack components now uses
release requests using changes proposed to the openstack/releases
git repository. This allows peer review of release requests,
including version numbers, and run a series of checks to make
sure the release is likely to be successful once the tag is
pushed. The same process supports the creation of additional repo
branches as well. This all ensures that releases are reported
correctly on the releases.openstack.org website.

As a result of this process, nobody needs to push tags directly
or create branches directly. As an official OpenStack project
team, PowerVMStackers has switched to using that process already
for recent releases. However the ACLs were not fixed to remove
direct tagging/branching yet.

Change-Id: I7b9db2c47f226032527405b8d5b0fe29c825e205

commit_message:
Enable py27/py35 unit test jobs for airship-deckhand

Deckhand already has configured py27 and py35 unit test jobs
in its tox.ini [0][1] and already is configured out-of-the-box
to work with OpenStack job conventions. This is to enable them in Zuul.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/airship-deckhand/blob/e1f22a76c73ef0de648f472d197ac9433524d8be/tox.ini#L21
[1] https://github.com/openstack/airship-deckhand/blob/e1f22a76c73ef0de648f472d197ac9433524d8be/tox.ini#L32

Change-Id: I174d5df008f6e000da1a3878afe75919312ea7aa
